newsitem.title: USA: Wheelabrator gets buyout bid from Waste Management.
newsitem.headline: Wheelabrator gets buyout bid from Waste Management.

text.p: Waste Management Inc. said Friday it bid $15 a share to acquire the 33 percent of Wheelabrator Technologies Inc. it doesn't already own.
Waste Management now owns about 67 percent of Wheelabrator's 157 million outstanding shares, Wheelabrator said in a news release.

Wheelabrator, a company that specializes in converting waste products into energy, was trading at $12.75 Friday when its stock was halted on the New York Stock Exchange shortly before the offer was announced.
Wheelabrator will appoint a special committee of independent directors to review Waste Management's proposal, the company said.
The offer requires approval from both the special committee and the holders of a majority of shares not owned by Waste Management, Wheelabrator said.
The committee is expected to enlist the assistance of a law firm and an investment banking firm for the review.
